str2: Then, at that time. From ho and hote; the when, i.e. At the time that.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Probably a fuller form of rheo; an alternate for epo in certain tenses; to utter, i.e. Speak or say.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
From eu and onoma; properly, well-named, i.e. The left; neuter as adverbial, at the left hand.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To travel, journey, go, die.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Vocative Masculine Plural
str2: To curse. Middle voice from katara; to execrate; by analogy, to doom.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From aion; perpetual.
Fire; the heat of the sun, lightning; fig: strife, trials; the eternal fire. A primary word; 'fire'.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: To make ready, prepare. From hetoimos; to prepare.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From diaballo; a traducer; specially, Satan.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From aggello; a messenger; especially an 'angel'; by implication, a pastor.
